critique: The document primarily aims to ensure the security of the Panama Canal during a time of potential war. The main emotions the President wants to elicit are likely a sense of security and perhaps a degree of fear in those who might consider violating the regulations. There might also be a sense of surprise at the strictness of the rules. Joy is unlikely to be an intended emotion, and sadness and disgust are not strongly suggested by the text. The initial scores reflect this assessment.
